intro: Argemone mexicana var. hispida, commonly known as the Mexican prickly poppy, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of the southwestern United States. It is characterized by its hairy, spiny stems and large, showy yellow or orange flowers. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds, which are often dispersed by wind. It thrives in dry, disturbed soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. This species is also known for its potential medicinal uses, though it contains toxic compounds that require careful handling.
